page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT & WOLSTON PEOPLE
page.content: Most{employment}is provided by Bluemel's factory, originally an artificial silk mill but now making motor accessories. At one time employing 800-900 people, mainly from surrounding villages, the factory now gives employment to 84 people mainly women. Children wrote about their visit in 1985 saying: "We saw plastic powder made into mudguards which were made into coils and then cut to size and we saw a machine that put names on bicycle pump cases." In addition there are many farms in the area, though Wolston has changed from a farming community to a commuter district. There is intensive{chicken farming}and British Telecom provides employment through the very modern Wolston{ {telephone exchange}. The two schools, police station, library, garage and{ {shops}all provide jobs.
